channel.title: UTORRENT portforward
channel.description: my utorrent portforwarding wont work, i get it on the good port, it sais port open on www.canyouseeme.org and also the runserver sais its online, but wen i try to log in on 127.0.0.1 it wont let me it sais error connecting and other people cant connect. please help its my only way off hamachi. i have everything i need, it just WONT WORK. PLEASE HELP MEH,

item.title: UTORRENT portforward
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Bryan Owner_Bryan
item.description:
@Owner_Bryan wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:478095”][quote author=Owner_Bryan link=topic=596293.msg4198790#msg4198790 date=1357867921]
The actual port forwarding is the easy part. Type your IP address into the Internet Browser, Should come up to a page asking for your Username & Password, its usually admin for the Username & password if not look on your internet box The internet router should say something like http://194.0.0.1 (Just an example its your actual IP address…) Under that it should have a username & password if so Type it in! Alright once your logged in go too Applications & Gaming… on the far left corner of the Application & Gaming page there should be an empty box just type in [ RSPS ] now for the actual port forwarding part. In [ External ] type in [ 43594 ] & do the same for [ internal ] – [ 43594 ] … For [ Protocol ] it should be left on [ Both ]… Make sure you Check Mark the … [ Enable box ]… Scroll down & click save settings boom!!! your DONE! I hope i helped

EDIT: & i never said it was impossible… i said its different…
[/quote]

You got the first part wrong. You type your ip address in, you won’t get anything. You need to type the default gateway in. (Usually 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1)[/quote]

Thats what i ment, i have no clue why i said IP! sorry!!

Here… Try using one of these if you still having problems port forwarding… Truthfully i think sk8trdyde461’s would be better but mine would be faster

Mine: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,596318.msg4198969.html#msg4198969

sk8rdude461: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,590760.0.html

Read full topic

item.title: UTORRENT portforward
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Owner_Bryan, post:8, topic:478095”]The actual port forwarding is the easy part. Type your IP address into the Internet Browser, Should come up to a page asking for your Username & Password, its usually admin for the Username & password if not look on your internet box The internet router should say something like http://194.0.0.1 (Just an example its your actual IP address…) Under that it should have a username & password if so Type it in! Alright once your logged in go too Applications & Gaming… on the far left corner of the Application & Gaming page there should be an empty box just type in [ RSPS ] now for the actual port forwarding part. In [ External ] type in [ 43594 ] & do the same for [ internal ] – [ 43594 ] … For [ Protocol ] it should be left on [ Both ]… Make sure you Check Mark the … [ Enable box ]… Scroll down & click save settings boom!!! your DONE! I hope i helped

EDIT: & i never said it was impossible… i said its different…[/quote]

You got the first part wrong. You type your ip address in, you won’t get anything. You need to type the default gateway in. (Usually 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1)

Read full topic

item.title: UTORRENT portforward
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Bryan Owner_Bryan
item.description:
@Owner_Bryan wrote:

The actual port forwarding is the easy part. Type your IP address into the Internet Browser, Should come up to a page asking for your Username & Password, its usually admin for the Username & password if not look on your internet box The internet router should say something like http://194.0.0.1 (Just an example its your Default Gate Way.) Under that it should have a username & password if so Type it in! Alright once your logged in go too Applications & Gaming… on the far left corner of the Application & Gaming page there should be an empty box just type in [ RSPS ] now for the actual port forwarding part. In [ External ] type in [ 43594 ] & do the same for [ internal ] – [ 43594 ] … For [ Protocol ] it should be left on [ Both ]… Make sure you Check Mark the … [ Enable box ]… Scroll down & click save settings boom!!! your DONE! I hope i helped

EDIT: & i never said it was impossible… i said its different…
